project_abstract.cdata: The project aims to increase agricultural production and farmer income in existing but presently underutilized village irrigation schemes which have deteriorated through inadequate maintenance and repair. The project consists of: (i) rehabilitation of about 12,000 village tanks and anicuts; (ii) strengthening of major government institutions involved in village irrigation; (iii) initiating a systematic water management program; and (iv) establishing evaluation program designed to assist project implementation and preparation of further village irrigation schemes. The project does not involve any unusual risk.
